title: Bug 38131ajc needs -d option while correctly compiling classes from subpackage
description: Bug 38131ajc needs -d option. I am using 1.1rc1. This is a regression since rc1 and a deviation from javac. I am guessing this may have to do something with change in the underlying Eclipse compiler. Create a class in a subpackage such as: package subpackage; public class Test { public static void main(String[] args) { System.out.println('Hello'); } } Then compile using the following command: ajc -d <output_directory> subpackage\Test.java. You will see a directory 'subpackage' created under the specified '<output_directory>'.
OB: When compiling a class in a subpackage using 'ajc' command without the '-d' option
EB: When compiling a class in a subpackage using 'ajc' command with the '-d' option
SR: 1. Create the necessary directory structure for the subpackage. 2. Open the command prompt and navigate to the directory containing the source file. 3. Execute the command 'ajc -d <output_directory> subpackage\Test.java', where <output_directory> is the desired location for the compiled class files.
